jutils

Class Help

  • java.lang.Object
    • jutils.Help

  • public class Help
extends java.lang.Object
    The Help class handles the returning of information in the "help Files" so that actual text in "program 'help' screens or on StdOut can be maintained in better editors, rather than directly embedded in the .java source files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Help()
      Basic Constructor for Help.
      Help(java.lang.Boolean nlFlag)
      Basic Constructor for Help.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Help

        public Help()
        Basic Constructor for Help. Defaults to not adding a NewLine after each line after read from the file.

      • Help

        public Help(java.lang.Boolean nlFlag)
        Basic Constructor for Help. Allows the user to pass a boolean to determine if a newline should be added after reading each line of the file.
        Parameters:
        nlFlag - Boolean indicating if a new line should be added (true) to the end of each line in the help file, or not (false).

    • Method Detail

      • setNLFlag

        public void setNLFlag(java.lang.Boolean nlFlag)
        Sets the newLine value to the passed in value
        Parameters:
        nlFlag - Boolean indicating if a new line should be added (true) to the end of each line in the help file, or not (false).

      • defineHelp

        public boolean defineHelp(java.lang.String ident,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> hFiles)
        Adds one or more help files to the list of help files, associated with an identifier for easier help file maintenance and display
        Parameters:
        ident - String identifier for this type of help
        hFiles - List of strings of file names to be read
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if a new entry was added (true), or if an existing entry was replaced (false)

      • getHelp

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getHelp(java.lang.String ident,
                                       boolean htmlOutput)
        Get the appropriate list of help files from the previously setup HashMap and return the concatenated results in a stringBuilder
        Parameters:
        ident - String identifier for this type of help
        htmlOutput - boolean indicating if the method is outputting to a 'window' and therefore needs HTML codes for proper display
        Returns:
        StringBuilder of the help message requested

      • getHelp

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getHelp(java.util.List<java.lang.String> hFiles,
                                       boolean htmlOutput)
        Read the appropriate help files and return the concatenated results in a StringBuilder
        Parameters:
        hFiles - List of strings containing the resource files to read
        htmlOutput - boolean indicating if the method is outputting to a 'window' and therefore needs HTML codes for proper display
        Returns:
        StringBuilder of the help message requested

      • getErrs

        public Errs getErrs()
        Returns the most recent error information
        Returns:
        Errs class containing the most recent error information

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the version number of this class.
        Returns:
        string value of version number

      • getAllVersions

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllVersions(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vlist)
        Returns list of mapped pairs of class file names and the version number. It also adds all called routines to the list. If the class file name and version is already in the list, it does not add them, it simply returns.
        Parameters:
        vlist - Map of the current class/versions to be appended to
        Returns:
        Map of the class/version values for this and all called routines
